messages.subject: Yanoni mei
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all - I ve posted a photo of a yanoni mei (Takesuye) in my Yahoo photos folder, Ron STL. Wondering if anyone has an explanation why this suye character
messages.messageBody:
Hi all -

I've posted a photo of a yanoni mei (Takesuye) in my Yahoo photos folder, Ron STL.

Wondering if anyone has an explanation why this "suye" character has the three (3) horizontal strokes through the verticle stroke, while all the books show only two (2) such strokes for "suye?" This 3-stroke usage makes this look like "rai" but I'm almost positive it is "suye."

What this is in reference to, awhile back I questioned a mei on a koto tanto here. I originally read that mei as "Rai Kuni(something)" but feel pretty convinced it is actually, "Suyekuni saku" with the "suye" carved as on the yanoni.

Any comments? (If link does not work, email me at: swords@... for the photo.)

http://tinyurl.com/2ccjz

Ron
STL

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
